alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 10:20AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Peoria, Stark and Tazewell. In west central Illinois, Fulton and Knox. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that rainfall had largely ended over the advisory area. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell earlier. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Peoria, Pekin, Galesburg, Canton, East Peoria, Morton, Washington, Bartonville, Creve Coeur, West Peoria, Abingdon, Knoxville, Marquette Heights, Farmington, Tremont, Elmwood, Bellevue, Mackinaw, Princeville and Delavan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
